qti-extended-text-interaction.qti-prompt: With the simple distribution discussed above (5, 5, 5, 10, 20), we could come up with reasons to favor both the median and the mean. In what sense might the median be a better model for this distribution? In what sense might the mean be a better model?

qti-choice-interaction.qti-prompt: How is the median the "middle" of the distribution? (Check all that apply.)

qti-simple-choice._: If all data points in the distribution are arranged in order, there are an equal number of data points below and above the median.
If all data points in the distribution are arranged in order, there are an equal number of variables below and above the median.
The sum of the values below the median is equal to the sum of the values above the median.
The median balances the amount of error below and above it.
The deviations above and below the median always sum to 0.

qti-choice-interaction.qti-prompt: How is the mean the "middle" of the distribution? (Check all that apply.)

qti-simple-choice._: If all data points in the distribution are arranged in order, there are an equal number of data points below and above the mean.
If all data points in the distribution are arranged in order, there are an equal number of variables below and above the mean.
The sum of the values below the mean is equal to the sum of the values above the mean.
The mean balances the amount of error below and above it.
The deviations below and above the mean always sum to 0.

qti-prompt._: Once we have  saved, which of these lines of codes $3.20 would return the median?

qti-simple-choice.span: I am an inline $$Y_i = 0 + \beta_1X_{1i} + \beta_1X_{2i} + \epsilon_i$$ LaTeX expression.
I am a block/centered \[Y_i = 0 + \beta_1X_{1i} + \beta_1X_{2i} + \epsilon_i\] LaTeX expression.

qti-simple-choice._: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.  The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

title: Example 3 - Using feedbackBlock to show a solution (random)

qti-assessment-item.title: Example 3 - Using feedbackBlock to show a solution (random)

p._: Find the value of  to 3 decimal places.

qti-feedback-inline._: No, that is not the correct answer

qti-content-body.p: Since you have viewed the solution, your score for this question will be 0.

small._: Template processing is used to randomly compute 1 of 4 permutations of this item.  The computed template variable values are then "stamped" (using QTI's math variable templating capability) into the MathML expressions in the prompt and in the provided solution which can then be revealed by clicking the  button.  Upon clicking the  button, QTI 3 Player ends the attempt, scores the response, and displays inline feedback.
The template variables - and the new correct answer - are re-computed each time you click the  button.

div.p: Monty Hall has hidden a prize behind one of these doors.

qti-content-body.p: Monty invites you to choose one of the doors but won't let you open it just yet.

p: Monty opens one of the other doors to reveal - a goat!
He then asks you if you would like to change your mind or to stick with the door you originally chose. It's time to make your mind up, which door are you going to open?

qti-content-body.p: Bad luck! When you opened your chosen door it also revealed a goat.
Congratulations! When you opened your chosen door it revealed a fantastic prize that you are now free to take home.

p._: Well, whether or not you won the prize did you make your decision by guesswork or logical reasoning? The question is, if we allowed you to play this game repeatedly what strategy  you adopt?

qti-simple-choice._: Always stick to the first door you chose.
Always switch to the other closed door when Monty offers you the chance.
It really doesn't matter whether you stick or switch - the outcome's the same.

qti-feedback-inline._: - this door is now open revealing a goat!
- this door is now open revealing a fantastic prize!
- this door is now open revealing a goat!
- this door is now open revealing a fantastic prize!
- this door is now open revealing a goat!
- this door is now open revealing a fantastic prize!

p.small: This is the "Monty Hall (Take 2)" adaptive item which uses template processing when the item is first loaded to randomly select the door containing the fabulous prize.

small._: Accept Monty's invitation and .  Then click the  button to proceed.

p.small: QTI 3 Player performs the response processing and reveals the next Feedback in the adaptive item until the adaptive item's built-in "completionStatus" outcome variable is set to "complete".

qti-content-body._: No. Initially, the probability of the prize being behind each door is 1/3. Opening a losing door can't possibly make this go down for the remaining closed one! In fact you should  stick to your original decision.
Yes, you should  switch doors when offered the chance. Congratulations, perhaps you should think about a career as a TV game show contestant?

p._: No, you should in fact  switch doors. This problem has fooled many mathematicians since it was first posed in an American magazine article and continues to present a seemingly paradoxical answer!

p: The probability of your first choice door hiding the prize is 1/3 and this can't change. But, 2/3 of the time you'll be wrong with your first choice and, by revealing a goat, Monty is effectively telling you which door the prize is behind the remaining 2/3 of the time! So by switching doors, your chances of getting the prize go up to 2/3!

In this item, the word "acronym" has a glossary support in this item's Catalog.   and the glossary definition appears!

qti-card.qti-html-content: An abbreviation usually created using the first letters of other words and pronounced as a word.

qti-content-body.p: Use the percent equation, part = percent × whole, to find the sales tax.
Which of these represents the dollar amount of the sales tax?

qti-simple-choice._: Sales tax rate times selling price
Sales tax rate divided by selling price
Sales tax rate plus selling price
Sales tax rate minus selling price

p._: The fraction form of the sales tax rate is .

span._: (Round to two decimal places as needed)

p.small: Last in this "Find the Sales Tax" item set, this is an adaptive item with template processing to compute all of the values and correct responses revealed in the Block and Modal feedback steps.  A good example of how assessment can align with curriculum and instruction to improve learner outcomes.

small._: Upon clicking the  button, QTI 3 Player ends the attempt, scores the interaction response (if any), and displays appropriate feedback.
You can click the  button to generate a new "Find the Sales Tax" item that follows the same solution method.

p: Sorry, your answer is not correct.
Correct Answer: sales tax rate times selling price
Sorry, your answer is not correct.

p._: Almost correct. You entered the correct sales tax amount, but in the .

p: However, currency is expressed with exactly two digits after the decimal point.
Sorry, your answer is not correct.

qti-content-body.p: Use the percent equation, part = percent × whole, to find the sales tax.
The sales rate times the selling price represents the dollar amount of the sales tax.

p._: The fraction form of the sales tax rate is .

p.small: This version of the "Find the Sales Tax" item demonstrates how a QTI adaptive item and template processing can be wired together to produce an experience that is more like a simulation than a measurement instrument.
QTI template processing generates variable values that are injected into the item's Feedback blocks to provide a solution method for computing Sales Tax from a given Selling Price and Sales Tax Rate.

small._: Upon clicking the  button, QTI 3 Player evaluates the current step in the solution method and reveals the next feedback.
Click  to generate a new "Find the Sales Tax" item that follows the same solution method.

p.small: This is the first of a set of three  "Find the Sales Tax" items which demonstrate various adaptive and templating capabilities of the QTI 3 Player component and of QTI itself.
In this item, QTI template processing generates variable values for a Selling Price, a Sales Tax Rate, and the correct answer for the given values.

small._: Upon clicking the  button, QTI 3 Player runs response processing, evaluates the response, and produces Modal Feedback.
Click  to generate a new "Find the Sales Tax" item and new template values.

p._: Almost correct. You entered the correct sales tax amount, but in the .

p: However, currency is expressed with exactly two digits after the decimal point.
